notes.content: HTML is easy
Browser can execute only JavaScript
GET and POST are the most important methods of HTTP protocol
CSS allows you to style HTML elements
JavaScript adds interactivity to web pages
Responsive design makes websites look good on all devices
HTML5 introduced new semantic elements
The DOM represents the page structure as a tree
AJAX allows updating parts of a page without reloading
HTTP status codes indicate the result of a request
JSON is commonly used for data exchange in web applications
Session storage stores data for the session's lifetime
Local storage persists data across browser sessions
Cookies can store small amounts of data for long-term use
CSS Grid allows complex layouts with fewer lines of code
CSS Flexbox helps align items within a container
Web APIs provide access to various browser features
Promises in JavaScript allow handling asynchronous operations
Async/await simplifies working with promises
Arrow functions provide a more concise syntax for functions
Event delegation improves performance in dynamic web apps
Virtual DOM improves performance in modern frameworks
React uses a component-based architecture
Vue.js is a progressive JavaScript framework
Angular is a full-fledged framework for building large applications
Webpack bundles multiple JavaScript files into one
ES6 introduced let and const for block-scoped variables
WebAssembly allows high-performance code in the browser
PWAs provide a native-like experience on the web
Service workers enable offline functionality in PWAs
OAuth is a widely used protocol for authorization
Cross-origin requests are controlled by CORS policy
JavaScript hoists variable declarations to the top of their scope
Babel transpiles modern JavaScript into backwards-compatible code
TypeScript adds static types to JavaScript
CSS preprocessors like Sass add variables and functions to CSS
REST APIs use standard HTTP methods for CRUD operations
GraphQL allows flexible querying of data in APIs
SEO optimization improves a website's search engine ranking
Web fonts improve typography across devices and browsers
SVGs are scalable and lightweight for icons and graphics
CDNs improve website performance by caching assets globally
Minifying CSS and JavaScript improves website load speed
Progressive enhancement ensures accessibility for all users
Graceful degradation maintains core functionality in older browsers
The box model defines how elements are sized in CSS
Padding adds space inside an element's border
Margin adds space outside an element's border
CSS specificity determines which styles are applied
Z-index controls the stacking order of overlapping elements
CSS animations add dynamic movement to web pages
Flexbox makes it easier to create flexible layouts
HTML forms allow users to send data to the server
Form validation ensures users submit correct data
JavaScript closures allow functions to access outer variables
Modules in JavaScript make code more modular and reusable
APIs allow communication between different software components
Testing ensures code works as expected and prevents bugs
Linting tools help maintain code quality by identifying issues
HTTPS ensures secure communication between client and server
WebSocket provides full-duplex communication between client and server
The event loop in JavaScript manages asynchronous operations
JSON.stringify() converts JavaScript objects to JSON format
JSON.parse() converts JSON strings back into JavaScript objects
Modern browsers come with built-in developer tools
HTML meta tags provide information about the page
A 404 error means the requested resource was not found
A 500 error indicates a server-side issue
A 200 status means the request was successful
A 301 status indicates a permanent redirect
A 302 status indicates a temporary redirect
Git is a version control system for tracking code changes
GitHub is a platform for hosting and collaborating on code repositories
npm is the default package manager for Node.js
JavaScript frameworks provide structure for building web applications
A front-end developer focuses on the user interface and experience
A back-end developer focuses on server-side logic and databases
A full-stack developer works on both front-end and back-end
Docker containers package applications and their dependencies
A/B testing helps optimize web interfaces
Heatmaps show how users interact with a webpage
UI stands for User Interface
UX stands for User Experience
Unit tests test individual pieces of code
Integration tests ensure different modules work together
End-to-end tests simulate real-world user interactions
A build tool automates tasks like minification and bundling
The Document Object Model represents the structure of a webpage
Event bubbling allows events to propagate up the DOM tree
Event capturing allows events to be caught as they travel down the DOM tree
Cross-browser compatibility ensures the site works across all browsers
Favicon is the small icon that appears next to the website title in the browser tab
Web components allow you to create reusable HTML elements
API keys are used to authenticate requests to services
JWT tokens are used for secure authentication between client and server
DevOps practices streamline development, deployment, and monitoring
A content delivery network (CDN) improves page load speed
Mobile-first design focuses on optimizing for smaller screens first
Lazy loading defers loading of non-critical resources until needed
Web accessibility ensures websites are usable by everyone, including people with disabilities
